caption.p: Some diagnostic criteria in Guillain–Barré syndrome.

th.bold: Criteria for diagnosis of Guillain–Barré syndrome

tr.td: Weakness within 4 weeks from onset of syndrome (starting muscle weakness in lower limbs)
Lack of fever in the patient
Infections of the respiratory and gastrointestinal system during the past few weeks
Increased protein concentration in cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) with moderate increase in the cell
